description:
I've been to many places for sushi in San Francisco and I just had to upload a review for Ariake.  My third time dining there and hands down, they have some of the freshest sashimi and tastiest nigiri anywhere. I asked the chef/owner where they source their fish and he informed me that twice a week it's flown from the eastern seas of Japan and Korea. The colder water white fishes are the best in those parts, and I certainly do not mind paying a couple of more dollars for it.

Great food... excellent service!!! My go to for sushi!
author: Wine Advocate A.

description:
Came here this past Tuesday evening and the room was just filled enough that we had to wait for a few minutes but quickly got our seat. I usually order rolls when I go to sushi restaurants, and especially salmon rolls, and so I got the 49er roll, Island roll, and the Cherry blossom roll.

Food, the rolls were decent, not the best I ever had, but I did like the Salmon. The amount of fish on the rolls were just right and they were good. The cherry blossom was a tuna roll, and although I usually like Tuna, I was a little taken aback by some of the flavor, and not sure if they had the freshest tuna on hand.

Service was ok. The first waitress that was helping us was not very helpful. She first gave us our drinks and then asked if we were ready, which we were still trying to make a decision, and then basically never came back. The second waitress was very attentive and started helping us through the ordering, getting us the free small plate of edamame that comes with the meal, and then getting additional wasabi and ginger, which they don't seem to give a lot of with the rolls themselves.

Overall, I would come again, but maybe avoid the Tuna here.
author: V W.

description:
This neighborhood Japanese restaurant does everything competently - and sometimes surprises. 

The decor is predictable for a neighborhood sushi haven: an intimate sushi bar, a seated area opposite, a flat-screen TV playing silently. The staff is attentive and informal.

Miso soup was hot, but quite ordinary, as was the tea. 
Veggie tempura was very crisp and flavorful, with nary a hint of greasiness. The dipping sauce, however, lacked much flavor at all.
Unagi nigiri was delicious - warm and appetizing. I can see why some might find a dish like Unagi Don so appealing.
The Crunch 13 roll had shrimp and crab meat, deep fried. The texture was appetizing, but the flavor was a bit bland; I probably should have had one of their more colorful, inventive rolls, instead.

The price was around $35. Ariake seems to be one of those places that requires more research to find the really great dishes. This time around, the food was simply...good.
author: Thirsty C.

description:
Wow !!! This place is absolutely delicious ! Service is unbelievable and the Shef is a Picasso ! 
Work of art !
author: Lena M.

description: This is my favorite sushi place! This place is pretty small but their fish is always super fresh and unbearably delicious! They are more about real sushi and don't have rolls that are smothered in sauces - don't get me wrong, if you are looking for rolls and sauces, you will get it - but you will get the real deal. Their chefs and waitresses are super nice and helpful if you need recommendations. Best place ever!
author: Lena T.

description:
A sushi restaurant that I recently tried w/friends.  They weren't busy at all.  I love to try gyoza at whichever restaurant that serves it.  I thought the gyoza was great!  but the sushi itself was also great.  There are so many rolls to try it's hard to pick.  I opted for the ariake roll topped w/seaweed salad - yum!
Ordered: gyoza ($7.50), ariake roll ($13), crunchy roll ($13), and dragon roll ($13)
author: Mikayla M.

description:
I came in with my GF for dinner at 8:30 on a Wed night. It was fairly packed, about 85% of the seating. We were greeted and seated quickly. 

We ordered the combination plate, lion king roll, and 49er roll. The combination plate was great, tasted fresh. The two other rolls tasted great as well.

The service was fantastic and friendly.

The price was on par with the quality of service and food. $102 with 15% tip for 3 appetizers, one large plate, and two rolls. 

Will be coming back again!
author: Robert R.

description:
In summary, pretty good sushi and sashimi for the price. The location is a bit to find parking, but... If you're from SF you should be used to that by now. The interior is cozy and decorated like a usual Japanese restaurant. Staff are Korean, but that doesn't mean the food isn't authentic! I struggled between giving this place a 3 or 4 star rating but I think 3 is appropriate since I felt it was quite average.

We got this carpaccio type dish. I think it was harame or yellowtail think sliced, dressed in ponzu, and topped with sliced onion and tobiko. It was good but... Way too much sauce. The fish was just drowning in it and we couldn't taste the actual fish much - this is probably why I don't remember what fish it was.

Next, we got a platter of sushi to share. I think it was Faith or Hope or something like that. It was good but nothing really memorable. 

I wouldn't go all the way out here just to come to this place, but if I'm nearby, I'll give this place another try!
author: Susanna C.

description: It's very tasty here. Large portions. Very friendly staff. On the TV showed football 2018 without sound. The cafe's disadvantages are that they do not have the calorie content of the dishes. The situation in the cafe is quiet. Everywhere is clean :)
author: Oleg K.

description: I went for Lunch. I had the most beautiful Chirashi I have ever had here. A surprizing variety of fresh fish. Excellent staff.
author: James A.

description: I adore this place. I work close by and come in 1-2 times a month for the bento box. The boxes are generously portioned for $14, and the sashimi is as fresh as $$$$ restaurants in the city. The specialty rolls are all amazing too. It always hits the spot, and I always eat the entire thing every time, no matter how hungry I am. All of the staff are very friendly and welcoming - they even let us order ahead for dine-in, and the food is ready when we arrive! That is 5 star customer service to me. Bonus points for having tamari for the gluten free crowd.
author: Kathryn P.

description: The food is good! BUT we love this place for the people. We bring our toddler here, and 100% of the staff seems to not only tolerate him.... but welcome him/play with him/truly enjoy him as a mini patron. They are the hosts with the mosts. It makes eating out all the more fun when it feels like the staff is having a good time too.
author: Sharon H.

description:
Service was so-so, the male Asian server was not very engaging or helpful with the menu. He didn't say hello, just escorted us to a table and dropped the menu.
Second wait person was much better and more conversant. 
Food was good, not Ozoke level, but good to better than average.
One problem, got a few scales in between my teeth with the Ariake tuna roll...

May come back to try different selections...
author: John M.

description:
My family and I were excited to try this place out as our usual go-to sushi spot was closed. Ariake was the closest to us w/in walking distance and was rated 4 stars on yelp, but I beg to differ. Our experience was unpleasant enough to warrant a review.

Service: We had to ask 4 times for a water refill and twice for soy sauce plates. By the time we got our soy sauce dishes, we had already finished all 4 of the rolls we ordered. The male server was friendly, but the older woman was not welcoming at all. She was pre-maturely taking plates off our table as we were still eating, so her fingers came dangerously close to my face.

Food: Honestly, I expected more for a 4-star restaurant. The quality of the fish did not meet my expectations. Our "Rainbow Roll" looked as if it was composed of scraps and the fish was definitely was not as fresh as some reviewers claimed it to be. In addition, I almost ALWAYS order the "Lion King" roll whenever I'm eating sushi, so you can trust my judgement when I tell you that the Lion King at Ariake was dry and bland. 

Price: If the food tasted better and was of higher quality, I wouldn't mind the $$$. But $70 for 4 mediocre rolls?? No thank you. Our total came to be $105, which included 2 combination lunches that were just as mediocre as the fish.
author: Michelle H.

description:
Really cute neighborhood joint. The sushi chefs and staff were very welcoming. They were even speaking to some of the "regulars" in Japanese! 

I had the tempura udon and a California hand roll. The udon broth was slightly bland, but the hand roll was tasty. I'll be sure to order more sushi next time, as that seemed to be their specialty.
author: Christina S.

description:
The unagi don here is amazinggggggg. Highly reccommend it. This restaurant is family owned and they are the nicest people ever. 

The nigiri and sashimi is fresh and delicious and have the fancy stuff like otoro and amaebi. 

If you live nearby, this place should be one of your regular go-tos. They will treat you well and quality is consistent.
author: Becca W.

description: Intimate setting. I was with one other, but we got seated pretty quickly at the bar. Extensive menu selection. Nigiri was phenomenal - very fresh fish and speedy chefs. Sake selection is... shall I say, long. They bring out edamame when you order a bottle of sake. Friendly staff. Will definitely come back!
author: Nathalie G.

description:
I have been passing by this sushi bistro hundreds time and finally have time to give it a try. This sushi place opens really late until 11 and we stopped by on a Friday night around 10pm, only 2 tables of customers.  We were hesitate a bit because lack of customers on Friday night. But I insisted give it a try based on so many good Yelp reviews. The decors of this sushi shop some how made me felt like I was in Japan. 

-Akimo (Monk Fish Liver).    
This is something we must ordered item every time. The sauce is refreshing and the portion is very generous too! 

-Omasake 12 pc         
Miso comes with Omasake, and surprising the there are huge clam inside! Feel so good with a bowl of warm soup when outside cold in SF NIGHT. 

I don't think i rmb the name of each pc but these 12 pc are so amazing and I don't think I have had them before. 

-Hamachi Mango roll  
Nice combination of mango and hamachi. The little sweetness from the mango kinda balance out the over all.

Drink:
-Echigo beer (500ml) 
produced by Japan's first and finest microbreweryin Niigata with Koshihikari rice and premium malt for a fresh and rich flavor. They have good selection of sake and beer not just Sapporo or Asahi. We are trying something new this time and we loved it so we had to Google where to stock up. Lol!!!  

We definitely enjoyed our Friday night out exploring new place and new food.
author: Joan K.

description:
I was wandering Geary, trying to decide upon dinner when I stopped in front of Ariake. Having always passed by, I decided to finally try this Japanese restaurant. I must say I was pretty disappointed by most facets of my visit. 

To begin, the service was pretty bad, bad enough to warrant writing about. Our waitress seemed like she didn't want to be there and constantly kept asking if we wanted more items after we explicitly said we were done ordering. Our food came out but we had no utensils to eat them with, and when I asked for chopsticks, it seemed as though I was doing her a disservice. 

We ordered the cherry blossom roll as well as an unagi roll. The cherry blossom roll was hardly fresh, while the unagi roll was passable. On top of that, the ginger served to us was old and dried up. Our rolls seemed far larger on the menu but came out to be much smaller, so I left the meal still hungry. Coupled with the fact that the rolls were more expensive than most restaurants, it made for a pretty lackluster experience. 

If you're on Geary and want Japanese cuisine or sushi, you'd do better to find somewhere else a few blocks away.
author: George K.

description:
Happy Valentine's day! Jun and his crew of sushi chef perfectionists have been a solid part of our sushi lives. Love everything. Andy, Young, and of course Jun make this the absolute best spot to have a "Cheers night". You let them pick the tastes, you won't be disappointed.  
Come here . You will have an incredible evening of sushi adventures
author: Suzanna G.

description: Poorly constructed roll fell apart. Didn't revive what we ordered and when we brought it up it wasn't rectified
author: E B.

description: The salmon teriyaki is amazing and they give good portions for their prices! It comes with miso soup that is also great, especially soothing for a sore throat. The staff is friendly and helpful. 10/10 great restaurant.
author: Isabella M.

description: The sushi here is hit or miss. I rate 3.5 star . The service is great. I love our server, really nice and great with kids. I really want to give a 4 star since he was so awesome but our uni took it away. The reason is I ask if they had Hokkaido uni which the chef said "yes" but end up being lied to and charged for a high price for Hokkaido uni. I was so excited to have my friend try the Hokkaido uni for the first time that I rave about how sweet and delicious it is until it arrived. I took the first bite and went into shock. I know I should have told the chef about it but didn't. I felt as an honest chef he should known especially by looking at it. I mean I had Hokkaido uni many times at many restaurants and Japan which I can tell you it's small, soft and sweet not fishy, bitter and slimy. My friend had the worse experience and I felt so bad for him. Sigh . Oh well it was nice hanging out with him and our server was great.
author: Christy V.

description: Romantic spot to get sushi and delicious hot dishes.  The tuna tataki was really special.  I'm going back just for that.
author: Meagan M.

description: Great sushi bar with a wide variety of options, and great service! The owners are very welcoming and the drink options are good.
author: Chris S.

description:
A cute and tiny sushi restaurant with tables on the side and bar seatings to watch the sushi chefs work their magic. There's also a TV in the corner. Service was super friendly. The sushi chefs immediately greet you when you enter and leave and the servers are quite attentive.

Rolls I've Tried (Ranked to Most Favorite to Least Favorite): 
- Maguro Mango
- Dragon
- Moon Dog
- Sweet Heart 

Their sushi rolls tasted fresh and you can tell the chefs took their time to perfect each roll. I suggest ordering their Special Rolls, especially the Maguro Mango roll. My boyfriend and I order our own roll for Manguro Mango. It's one of our favorite rolls EVER.

We come here again and again because of their rolls and good service!
author: Kristal D.

description:
I've been spoiled with really good sushi lately. Of course, I can't compare Ariake to the $$$$ places. However, we can't eat $$$$ sushi every day, so my boyfriend and I are on the hunt for our go-to neighborhood spot with the best quality and value that doesn't make our wallets cry.

Quality's pretty decent. I ordered the lunch sashimi and everything tasted fresh. 

Value wise, my sashimi lunch was not worth $19. It came with miso soup, but I was expecting a side salad or rice. Maybe I've just been spoiled at similar places that provide this with their sashimi meals? My boyfriend ordered a two item lunch bento, and for $12 that's a steaaaaaal. 

I'd probably come back for their $12 lunch bento, but a) I'm never usually in SF during weekday lunchtime and b) I don't crave bentos. If you like bentos, though, then this is the place for you!
author: Laverne N.

description: Came in to grab a late lunch.  Our waiter was great but I found the dishes over priced for what was served.  They didn't offer any lunch specials over the weekend, which was a disappointment as that looked the most interesting.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Very small and very slow.

Unfortunately, I didn't have a very good experience at this place for lunch. I went with some coworkers for lunch and nobody else was there but the wait for our food took a solid 45 minutes. It was unfortunate because lunches should be that time in total and not just waiting for everyone's order to come out. Servers were nice and came by to refill our teas a coupe of times.

I had the Oyaku Udon and it was ok but the presentation wasn't very appealing and it could have used more seasoning.
author: Laura Y.

description:
Was randomly in this neighborhood and this sushi restaurant came highly recommended!
Called for a reservation for 2 around 6:30 pm. When I called back to inform them we were running a bit late, the woman on the phone was so friendly and understanding about it. When we finally arrived 20 min later, they already had 2 spots at the bar waiting for us. The restaurant is small and very cozy. We were greeted by the sushi chefs and treated as if we were family. 

Started with some house hot sake, complimentary edamame and white tuna tataki. Everything was so fresh and delicious. We also shared 3 more rolls - ariake, cherry blossom and double albacore. Of the 3, my least favorite was the ariake roll, but it was still a very fresh and above average sushi roll. The prices are reasonable, portions are very generous and extremely hospitable staff that made us feel like family. I could definitely tell that this place is a local favorite. Can't wait to come back and try some more of the special rolls and nigiri.
author: Yin H.

description: Quality of the fish and selection is spectacular. I had excellent ama ebi, toro, ocean trout, blue fin, jack mackerel and Amber Jack. Really amazing fish I don't get to have in Santa Cruz. Friendly staff and fairly priced. Good miso soup.
author: Ray F.

description:
My friend raves about this place and we finally made it out here after talking about it for a year. To be honest, I was a little disappointed. Maybe he oversold it to me but otherwise, I thought it was too pricey for the quantity and quality of food.

We got the following:
- ankimo appetizer
- live scallop sashimi
- toro sushi
- anago sushi
- hamachi mango roll

All this came out to be a $75 bill. The most egregious was $20 for the live scallop. It was really just one scallop, thiiiiiiinly sliced into 8 pieces. Not worth 20 bucks seriously.

Objectively, the ankimo and toro were pretty good. Anago was okay. Hamachi mango roll was okay. The best part of it was the asparagus, but otherwise the hamachi and mango were lackluster.

It's a friendly place - both the chefs and waitresses were very nice and attentive. However, for better sushi at a better price, I recommend Kazu or Wild Sushi in the Sunset, or Yuubi in the Richmond.
author: Sherry L.

description: This is the best sushi in the city! The quality of the fish is unequalled. The service is always friendly with a personal-touch. Simply the best!!
author: Mark M.

description: Love this place. Not only is the fish excellent but the most difficult part is rice melts in a warm good way
author: Diana R.

description: I love this place. Their mango rolls are great. Customer service is excellent. My go-to sushi spot :)
author: Jennifer S.

description:
The only reason why I came here tonight is because Turtle Tower from down the street ran out of food an hour before closing. I quickly did a search for Yelp for nearby restaurants and Ariake had the highest ratings and most reviews of all sushi restaurants.

The restaurant is very narrow and small, I doubt they could serve more than 20 customers at the same time. My boyfriend and I were seated at the table and we were shocked when we looked through the menu. $15 for a dragon roll?! We understand that San Francisco is expensive, but DAMN! The cheapest roll on the menu was a the crunchy roll which is basically fried tempura and carrots. We ordered the lion king, Bob's, and a hamachi roll. 

I disagree with the older reviews. This is not the best Japanese restaurants in town and the fish is most definitely not fresh. 

The staff is friendly but too soft. I asked what bonito was and they whispered "something like albacore." I asked them to repeat and they barely increased their volume and said "like tuna!" 

I would've walked out if I wasn't starving. $50 for three rolls is not worth it. Save your money and eat sushi at another city.
author: Danae L.

description:
Small, quaint little hole in the wall that served pretty decent chirashi don! They have different types; hope, love, & another one which, for the life of me, I can't remember. What surprised me about this place was they they served sea urchin! Quite rare for little jap places. Do try their rolls, it's not too bad! 

The waitresses were really cute; it was game night (the Warriors were playing), & they (both customers, and waitresses alike) were all crowding around the tv cheering!
author: Alyssa Chloe T.

description: We wandered in here because we happened to be walking through the area at lunch time, and were surprised at the quality of our sushi! We ordered the cherry blossom, 49'er, and fireman rolls, and it was some of the best sushi we've had in SF. I wish we lived closer, because this would be our three-times-a-week go-to sushi joint!
author: Cassandra J.

description: Asked for omakase sashimi for two and they end up charging us $90 dollars for that alone on top of everything else we ordered (party of 2). We complaint to them because it was a lot of sashimi for two people and normally it's not that much. The bill was over $250 and  they refuse to admit any wrong doing. There was nothing fancy in omakase to justify the price either so we felt ripped off. We're never coming back again.
author: Aylee G.

description:
This is one of the best sushi restaurants in the entire city. The fish is fresh, the rolls are flavorful, the service is excellent and the chefs are talented! 

I come to Ariake at least once a week and am a huge fan of their Lion King and Dragon rolls, among others. 

It's a small place and fills up fast (busy times are 6-8pm), but worth the wait.
author: Kathryn D.

description: My go-to spot when I just want some sushi. Staff and service are great. I feel like family when I walk in.
author: Kristine S.

description:
This place auto-wins because it's a Japanese restaurant that stays open until 11 PM on Mondays through Thursdays, midnight on Fridays and Saturdays. Staying open past 10 PM--that's herra rare for Japanese restaurants!

When we arrived around 10:15 PM, we had to a wait a few minutes for an open table. Looking through Yelp reviews, there wasn't a strong consensus for must-order items, but a good number did mention the Moon Dog special roll. Which is exactly what I chose.

The MOON DOG, $14, is an 8-piece roll stuffed with prawn tempura and crab, topped with seared tuna and special sauce (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ariake-japanese-restaurant-san-francisco?select=tkz1Qpo4Qxzxk2Glir7v4g#zBEvOlPMsQ34W8XYk12jiQ). The seared tuna is nicely subtle and smoky, and the tempura added that textural dimension. The special sauce and Japanese mayo weren't too heavy, and the freshly diced scallions were appreciated. They seasoned the sushi rice with furikake and used cucumber slivers in the roll. Sadly, I didn't really taste the crab.

My boyfriend ordered dinner entree #6, the SALMON SHIOYAKI, $16, which is broiled salmon without teriyaki sauce (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ariake-japanese-restaurant-san-francisco?select=tkz1Qpo4Qxzxk2Glir7v4g#Nd7ZBcAGWVemFkqPgIYBJw). Since it's a dinner entree, it's served with miso soup and mixed greens salad. The entree dish also comes with a pile of shredded pickled daikon and another pile of seaweed salad (double yum). The salmon wasn't strongly flavored but wasn't dry either. Not the moistest I've had, but tasty nonetheless.

The food is good, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here. Unfortunately, I couldn't bite the bullet and convince myself to order their slightly pricey raw fish dishes. I'm starting to follow a trend of either paying dirt cheap for mediocre fish, or paying oodles for amazingly high quality fish (e.g. Tekka). But, when it's past 10 PM, and you're craving Japanese, Ariake becomes your default option :P
author: Adele F.

description: Still my favorite Japanese restaurant in my hood.  The fish is always so fresh, innovative rolls, sashimi excellent.  I feel like I am in Tokyo when I eat at this gem of a restaurant.  Service is always friendly and good.  Do start with the firecracker, amazing combination of ingredients, so delicious. I always order beer or wine, their rolls deserve champagne!!
author: Carole W.

description: Fantastic sushi with such fresh fish. Love their specialty roles. The owners are really great ppl too. Highly recommend this spot!
author: Leena E.

description: Love this place - a real neighborhood feel with great fish.  Let Jin lead you through the latest Tsukiji arrivals and top it off with some nice cold sake. Fun with a bunch of locals on most nights.
author: Bruno S.

description:
Came here the other day to celebrate a friend's birthday. Our experience from start to finish was amazing. All of the fish here is super fresh and fantastic!! The Scottish Salmon Nigiri, the Tataki, and the 49'er Roll were my favorites. We also ordered Unagi, Butterfish, and Uni Nigiri. All delicious. We were a table of 5 so ordering Nigiri can be a problem because it's usually 2 pieces per order. Our server, David, who was truly the best, offered to make all of the nigiri 5 pieces. 
David was also kind of enough to send out a very nice bottle of Sake to our friend who was celebrating her birthday. He also was kind enough to allow me to bring in the cupcakes I had made for my friend. 
The sushi here is top notch!! Lots of places to choose from in this neighborhood and this spot does not disappoint. Absolutely Delicious!
But the star of the show, hands down, is the service. David, his Rock Star Sushi Chef Dad, all the sushi chefs, and the whole service staff here made this day truly wonderful and unforgettable. 
Thank you all so much for your kindness and hospitality. Can't wait to come back!
author: Dana S.

description:
All I can say it .. This is my fave sushi place in SF

I've been eating here since when I first moved here. It's about 7-8yrs now
I love how the chef has his hospitality mind and how he cares about his client.  
The most important is Fish!!
All fish here is very fresh n different than regular others sushi place. 

I took my mom and my girl last week and they never disappointed us:)

I will be back again for my hubby bd .. It's a specialty jap place I'm gonna show him
author: Regina A.

description:
We just arrived from a week in Tokyo, and what's the first thing we crave upon return?More sushi! One can never have enough!

While it's tough to top an omakase meal at Tokyo's famous Tsukiji market, Ariake does a pretty decent job of satiating our craving. Got some oysters, ankimo, uni, blue fin, amaebi and toro nigiri -- very happy with my selection! The quality of the fish was superb -- it's a cut above the other Richmond area sushi restaurants we've tried.  Our kids also enjoyed their tempura shrimp udon and agedashi tofu. 

By the way, it's a small restaurant but quite popular, so come early to find parking and get your name on the wait list.  It's worth the wait!
author: Dawne L.

description:
I've passed Ariake plenty of times going up and down Geary, but never gave it a chance until last night. 

The restaurant is very small, with a bar and 4-6 tables. Although small, it's very nice and gives off a more authentic feel. For a Saturday night, they were packed but we arrived just as a table cleared so no wait, yay! Because it was a full house, it took 30 minutes before our first dish came. They gave us free edamame as we waited, so all is forgiven. 

We ordered the Tataki - small, Maguro Maguro, Double Albacore, and the Rainbow roll. The Tataki was delicious and the small was more than enough for our party of 3. I definitely recommend it! The rolls were good, but the Maguro Mango was a little too sweet due to the creamy sauce. Oh, we also got half a dozen of the Kumamoto oysters and they were amazinggggg! They're 2.50 each and very small, but so good! Definitely try them! 

Because it was busy, it did take a while before our tea was refilled and we had to ask twice before we got the check. Overall a great experience and I hope to be back soon.
author: Doris K.

description:
My friend and I dropped by Ariake after we got a good beating at kendo practice. Excitement overtook my weary body as my eyes spied cooked and fried sushi rolls: my favorites. Could they be as good as the ones at my favorite sushi place: Cha Cha in San Jose?

The rolls we got were a mixed bag. I really enjoyed their Lion King Roll (crab, avocado, wrapped in salmon and baked with special sauce). The roll had a little tangy kick towards the end of each bite that I couldn't really put my finger on, so I figured the special sauce was just doing its thing. On the other hand, the Godzilla Roll (fried yellowtail topped with sweet and spicy sauce) was totally disappointing. Some pieces of this roll had barely any fish in them. 

Dessert was again a mixed bag. The Green Tea Cheese Cake should actually be called Green Tea Ice Cream Shaped Like a Cake. It looked like what I'd imagine green tea cheese cake looks like, but it was FROZEN. I want my cheesecake to be soft and creamy, not hard. The Strawberry Mochi Ice Cream was good, but nothing mind-blowing. 

Service was friendly, yet we had to repeatedly ask for refills. We had just spent 2 hours in heavy armor beating each other with wooden swords so we were pretty parched. Even after we kindly asked, explaining to the waitress that we were pretty thirsty, it still took a while to get our refills.
author: Mark C.

description:
Cousins saw this place on a commercial and wanted to come. Made a RSVP for 4 on Wednesday at 7:30. 3 of us arrived first at 7:10, a waitress greeted us, informed her we have a RSVP for 7:30 and she said oh okay, just sit there (gestured for the table we were standing next to) 
The place is small, so it looked pretty busy when we walked in (playoffs were on, so many Caucasians in the building)
On our table had ONE menu, after 5 minutes of sitting there, no one came up to ask us what we would like to drink and waitress didn't bring us another menu until I requested for 2 more. 
We ordered after 10 mins of deciding what to eat ... waitress brought out my salad first but my entree soup dish didn't come out until the end of the meal. The rest of our order of sushi rolls came out one after another and we were impressed. It was good. Every flavorful, well blended, place nicely. But I was disappointed with one roll, Island roll (pic shows lots of avocado, but we only got bits) While eating, waitress came up to us a few times to ask how is our food, do we need any more tea? 
After our meal, we asked for the check and that was it. 
We plan on coming back later on to try the rest of the rolls and I hope they will bring us more menus without having to ask.
author: Fiona B.

description:
All the other reviews are such inside job... Fresh fish..? Seriously? I ate most of the decent sushi place and this isn't the worse I ever experienced but it certainly the most expensive for 3 roll... 

Place is small but it's fine cause some people like it cozy. However, the food and the price was definitely a major no. If you are dying and must eat as well as have butt load of cash to blow? Sure come here... If you want decent price and decent food... I definitely go somewhere else. 

I gave 2 star cause the staff were nice but that's it.
author: Tony L.

description:
I have been to many many Japanese restaurant in San Francisco, I accidentally found the sushi in Ariake are very fresh, surprising they are not that busy.
I definitely will come back again.
author: BeFree Y.

description: Delicious food and good service.  I've been lived in neighborhood for 4 years and never been here before.  First time, very impressive for food and service. Variety of fish, taste good and fresh, nice waitress and cozy.
author: Gin C.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

1/1 Star: street parking was easy to find. No wait to be seated. 

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star: great service. Clean. Cozy ambiance. Great place for a date for to get some food and drinks with some friends. Intimate setting. There is also a TV if you want to watch the game.

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

3/3 Stars: The salmon skin hand roll is a MUST TRY! Hands down the best one I've had so far! The lion king roll was also really delicious. The uni was fresh and tasted like the uni served in Japan.  

_____

Overall Experience

5/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words
The food was so good that it was eaten on sight!  Didn't have a chance to take any pictures =( 

I will definitely eat here again!
author: Elliott N.

description:
The sushi is pretty good. I'd highly recommend the Hon Zake nigiri if they have it. 

Just for food alone, I'd give this place 4 stars, but the service and price are pain points. The service was slow and inattentive. It's listed as $$ but it's really more in the $40-$50 per person if you come for dinner.
author: Theresa M.

description:
"Dude, I don't care.  Order whatever for us.  Just don't mess up...YELPER."

Ugh...talk about pressure!  All that was missing was an evil, maniacal laugh.  While it was nice being able to get whatever I wanted, it was a little tough making sure I ordered something we both would like.  Good thing I was just ordering for my lazy ass friend instead of a really hot date!  ;)

- Toro Nigiri, Hamachi Nigiri, King Salmon Nigiri (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kd4Xqgpkkv5vftm2ayCWrA#8UFMgLL1qMdwkA_wrzFOOA)
Across the board, the fish were really fresh.  The Toro was great (not overly rich or fatty), the Hamachi was good, and the King Salmon was solid.  I really like how generous the size of their cuts were.  Huge portions!

- Fire Cracker Roll - Fried Shiso Leaves topped with Three Types of Spicy Tuna (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kd4Xqgpkkv5vftm2ayCWrA#3nSWnOokjH2aVV81cquOoA)
Although I couldn't tell the difference between the types of spicy tuna, their combined flavor was pretty good with just the right amount of heat.  The wakame (seaweed salad) gave it some crunch, and the shiso leaves added their own unique flavor.

- Moon Dog Roll - Shrimp Tempura and Crab Meat topped with Seared Tuna, Tobiko and Special Sauce (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kd4Xqgpkkv5vftm2ayCWrA#nkt3SbKbt-COU1zhEJUKmw)
Generally, I try to avoid rolls with cooked or fried elements (with the exception of shrimp tempura, seared tuna, and unagi).  So naturally, the one full of cooked components ended up as my favorite.  The tuna had a perfect sear, and the tuna, crab, and shrimp worked great together.

- Dragon Roll - Eel, Cucumber, Shrimp Tempura, Avocado, and Crab Meat (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kd4Xqgpkkv5vftm2ayCWrA#YeSX-LuDJeIjxX0eZlku-g)
I had actually ordered the Double Albacore roll, but they put us down for a Dragon Roll instead.  Oh well.  The roll was fine and looked good, but it didn't taste spectacularly different from other restaurants. 

Even though they can't challenge Kabuto as one of my favorite Japanese restaurants, Ariake is still up there for me.  The sashimi was great, service was friendly (even though they had a roll wrong), and the prices were fair.  Really, just not a lot not to like.  Plus, their good food made it that much easier for me to maintain my Yelp cred!  How can I argue with that?
author: Mike L.

description:
Came here for the first time with some friends. We tried four different rolls and an order of sashimi for 19 dollars. Sushi was pretty good but the maguro mango was mind-blowing amaziiiing. I will definitely go to this place by myself just to get that roll.

Minus one star because of the sashimi. We thought it was overpriced for the quantity and quality.
author: Mariah D.

description:
A hidden gem in the Richmond District! This is the best sushi I've had in the city and here's why:

-Super close walking distance to me. Sushi anytime!

-Delicious, and FRESH fish for nigiri or sashimi. I was really impressed with the freshness of the Hon Maguro my first visit, but my second visit it was a lot stringier...but still fresh. They made up for the stringiness by giving me a little extra maguro as sashimi on the side. They have a board behind the sushi bar that shows what their "catch of the days" are---follow this, try something new, and you will be set.

-Really delicious specialty rolls. I'm not a huge fan of lots of mayo sauces, so if you are along the same parallel as me, great! Order the Hamachi Mango or Dragon rolls. The tempura in the rolls doesn't overwhelm the sushi, if you know what I mean. If you like more mayo-y sauces they have a few of those too: Moon Dog and Bob's rolls.

Disclaimer: very small space with limited tables. I usually sit at the bar, but even that sometimes gets crowded. Be forewarned that you may need to wait for a good 30min for a table, but it's worth it!
author: Liz G.

description:
***************************** 1,048 *******************************

       A decent sushi joint runs by Korean family, not Japanese, this tiny hole-on-the-wall place is always pack on WED-SAT nights. They do have fresh fish, sometimes from Maine, and Japan depends on season. 

- Ikejime Tai red sea bream

- Otoro fatty tuna belly wasn't that fresh this time, must be an off day. 

- Flounder and Aji nigiri was nice.

- Tempura was good.

- Ankimo wasn't housemade.

- Scallop served on shell was fresh and delish.


      Reasonable price and always friendly service.
author: Manda Bear B.

description:
This restaurant is great for traditional Japanese sushi. The quality of fish here is delicious! It's a sleeper restaurant that no one seems to know about. The sister restaurant Kabuto, down the street, is known more for the creative sushi. However Ariake is awesome for the regular, typical nigiri and sashimi. However they have some great rolls too!

The "Love" Combination is great. I would suggest the Chirashi (donburi style) since I think they give you more rice that way. I've had that combo as a sashimi dinner, which was great, but I was not full at the end, which can be disappointing if you're really hungry.

The service here is really sweet. There's one girl that is very personable, and funny. I don't know her name but she's a young Asian girl, and she interacted like we were friends, even though I hadn't been there before!

I came here recently with my friend on a Friday night. At 5:30pm, I asked if we could make a reservation for 7:30pm for 2 people. They said sure! And we were glad I made the reservation, because it was packed that Friday night. It's a sleeper on weekdays, but I guess it becomes quite popular on the weekends.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Where do I begin? I've been eating at Ariake for 20+ years and it's been my go-to quality sushi spot. Jin has always served big pieces of quality fish, offering sterling service and superb quality. Unfortunately, it appears he has recently chosen to cater to the takeout crowd at the expense of service, portions and quality. 

I don't write many Yelp reviews and I'm not going into laborious detail. Suffice it to say I was so disappointed tonight - lack of attention, small pieces, poor cuts and massively slow service - that I shall never return. 

Jin has probably made a good financial decision for his business by embracing the explosive demand for take-out food in SF, but it's too bad that it comes at the expense of his most loyal patrons. I hope he survives the next downturn. 

Ps. My gf and I are still so hungry after spending $140 on aforementioned meal that we just ordered pizza.
author: Andrew J.

description:
The best Japanese place in town! Although there are many Japanese places in the city, it's hard to find a good authentic sushi place reasonably priced like Ariake.

Amazing customer service! Every single staff including the servers and the chefs are super friendly and welcoming. They are also very knowledgeable about their specials and the menu. 

Excellent food! Ariake only serves the highest quality of the fish. They also have daily specials that are not typical fish you find anywhere but unique and different. I highly recommend this place if you want to try something new. 

If you are a sushi lover like myself I highly recommend this place.
author: Sunjoo K.

description:
Super friendly, my to go order was promptly brought out in less than 15 minutes. The food, the ambiance, and the service was authentically Japanese. So much so that it was a little difficult to communicate to our waitress in english. Nonetheless, I can't wait to try more stuff here.

I was so hungry and in such a hurry i almost forgot to take a picture of the to go order of spicy tuna and spicy yellowtail rolls. Wow they were super delicious. I didn't even dip them in soy sauce or wasabi. The masago that covered the rolls had a light and salty taste to it. They were perfect.

I'm definitely going back for a full meal the next time I get a chance. 

Prepare for street parking and a possible wait for a seat.
author: Lloyd B.

description:
Came in for a late dinner on a Friday night and the wait wasn't too long. The waitresses were very attentive from the moment we sat down. Sometimes sushi places can get intimidating especially if you don't have the things that are listed on the menu but the waitresses were extremely helpful.

Now onto the food. I ordered the 12 piece chef's choice Omakase as my dinner for the evening. It is a fixed dinner wheeee you have the option of a mushroom or clam miso soup, a small sashimi appetizer, 12 pieces of nigiri, and a choice between red bean and green tea ice cream.  

The clam miso was interesting because the clam definitely added a different level of flavor to your average miso soup. The sashimi dish was not explained but it was some type of seared fish seasoned with sauces and daikon radish. Both were a good starter and the sashimi had a nice tangy flavor to it. The seared fish provided an interesting contrast when being eaten. 

Now the star of the set meal the nigiri. The progression of the different kinds of fish that was served to us was harmonious. We started with light subtle fish and as the meal progressed the chef started bringing out the big flavor a with the stronger tasting fish. Each piece had the perfect amount of wasabi added to bring out the flavor and the waitress was kind enough to explain every piece that was brought out. The salmon nigiri was probably the best pieces of salmon I've had so far because it was just melt in your mouth good. She also explained that we should follow a certain order to get that flavor progression. 

Overall a great experience with fresh fish and great Omakase. The waitresses and chefs all said thank you and goodbye as we left the restaurant, another highlight in their excellent customer service.
author: Ralph B.

description:
This is the perfect neighborhood sushi restaurant.

Excellent fish, excellent service, comfortable and lively.

Hamachi Kama was super juicy and crispy, the Gomaee (spinach with sesame sauce) was bomb.
Sushi was really good- We had the special Yellow Jack Nigiri, 49er Roll, Cherry Blossom, and Dragon Roll. The Salmon was so incredible that we ordered a Island Roll when we were already full.

Highly recommend!
author: Hallie C.

description:
Jin, the main man over here behind the bar, makes the best dragon roll not only in SF,  not only in the Bay Area, not only in California but in my opinion,  the best dragon roll on of the western AND eastern seaboards. I have to be honest, I haven't been through the Midwest or the south much so the possibility exists of a sleeper cell sushi spot in Greenbow Alabama which I haven't visited yet that might be better but as for now I rate this an unparalleled dragon roll. I have one hell of a story about it as well, which I love telling every time I come here and tie one on haha. 
Over all the joint is top notch,  very comfortable atmosphere, super solid service and always a great place for a dinner date (as long as she loves sushi).
author: Pj C.

description: I had a nice lunch here.  Rolls are kind of small but decent prices.  The Crunchy roll was nice, with the tempura very crunchy not overly hard.  Also had the Seaweed Salad, which had a good amount of sashimi pieces, which was decent but not the best I've had.
author: Karen L.

description: I would've given this place four stars in the past, but here's why they only deserve three now: The seasonal live scallops are tiny. Seriously, tiny. Like, babies. And $25! I expected so much better. I could've had a few portions of the hotate nigiri for that price. The soft shell crab comes with more greens than crab and is too burned. The calamari, which I had had before, are good. The hamachi and mango roll disappointed me a bit this time. The presentation is sloppy. Why not at least take care to include both hamachi and mango on each piece?
author: Paulina F.

description:
I have only tried cooked lunch items and a few rolls. Have yet to try the sashimi.  

The hot/cooked items are a winner here.  Of note is the unagi donburi which has a beautiful presentation, homemade bento box style! Exudes a very warm and homey feeling.  The unagi and rice have great flavor and texture.  I also love the addition of pickled vegetables which complement the unagi quite nicely. 

The rolls are so-so; I didn't find the fish very fresh and the pieces were tiny.  Disappointing, but I'm hoping sashimi and nigiri orders will be better.
author: Renee L.

description: Great neighborhood sushi spot! We usually go here for dinner and get a few sushi rolls, nigiri, and sake. The staff is friendly and makes good recommendations if you're unable to choose. There is limites bar space and about 5 table tops. Usually the tv has a sports game, Giants/Warriors when in season.
author: Shea T.

description: Don't go there. Owner is very rude. I don't eat much so I was going to share a plate with a friend. First, he tried to convince us to get two different plates but when I insisted that I don't usually eat much and that we would share only one plate, the owner told us he doesn't sell only one plate for two people sharing. I told him we would leave and his response was, I'm the owner and I don't sell just one plate for two people, that's my policy, your welcome to leave. So we left. No wonder why this place was so empty. Zero customer service.
author: Ariana C.

description:
Korean owned place with Japanese Sushi chefs. HM...

Came here for a dinner with a friend to check out the craze. We sat at the bar and ordered two bottles of Japanese coke? Interesting. 

FOOD: (+3)

Love Sushi - It came in 3 plates of nigiri style sushi. Uni, Toro and Sake nigiri to name a few. 

Japanese Coke - What's the difference between Japanese coke and Coca Cola?! Coke is Coke!

SERVICE: (-2)

Sketchy. Waitress sorta hovered near us silently and didn't really answer our questions about certain rolls. Like seriously, SPEAK UP INSTEAD OF FXXKN MUMBLING!!! This AIN'T ASIA! The sushi chefs were more engaging than our waitress. 

I'd only probably come back here for the food, but not the service. I'm glad we didn't sit at a table! It would be like being in a foreign country but even worse cuz this is the USA! WTF MAN?!
author: Jason C. J.

description: I was so sad when Umami closed in the Marina, but now I've found my new favorite sushi place. Excellent!
author: Tara M.

description:
Came here on a Wednesday since my favorite Japanese restaurant in the Richmond was closed so I decided to try this place out for the first time, and it will be my last.

Ordered $150 worth of food to go, charged me $180. Went back to the restaurant to resolve the issue and they gave me the run around and said only the owner is able to credit my account. Not a problem, that was on 3-3-2015. I spoke with the owner on the phone and he said he will credit my account right away. Two business days later and I still see no credit on my account. 2 business days is NOT right away.

Tell me something, when a merchant makes a mistake on the bill, whether you're shopping for clothes or groceries, they correct the mistake on the same day, on the spot. It doesn't take 48hrs to correct a charge, the owner could have invited me back to the restaurant and given me the cash difference or a $30 credit plus compensation for my time and everything would have been resolved.

What shady business practice. Words are useless, action is ultimate form of sincerity.
author: Panchali S.

description:
Large Tataki, Double Albacore, Moon Dog and Hamachi Mango.

That is my order EVERY time I come here (at least monthly). Each time it's just as good as I can imagine and better than I remember.
author: Ro L.

description:
(story continues after my 2 previous sushi restaurant reviews) 

SUCCESS!

After days of research, phone calls, and trying numerous restaurants...

So, I called a chef/owner friend, who called a magazine publisher friend (she is Japanese) and recommended Ariake. We wanted a basic sushi restaurant that had low-key atmosphere, excellent sushi, quality, and value. We  weren't trying to find an 'impress your bimbo date' place.

PRO

Everything was exceptional! Friendly staff, great tempura, Uni was fresh, fresh sardines (Yum!), excellent sake' selection, pricing was right, and  great ambient ambiance.

CON
 
I have nothing bad to say. I know, unusual for me when it comes to food.
(if I had to say something: the rice could of been a bit stickier.)

Yes, I will return. Actually, placed reservations for our wedding party here.
author: Rich F.

description:
FOOD
1.) chicken udon - simple basic good
2.) tatake - Mm pretty good, kinda sour w I dno lemon juice


SERVICE
Very good. Had a big group n they did a good job pouring all our tea etc


ATMOSPHERE:
Nice small intimate Japanese feel :) like a dive bar layout but it's a sushi bar on the left side
author: Angela L.

description: Get the seaweed roll with spicy tuna! Da bomb $12. The miso was good, little on the salty side. Cost about $2-3. Great little stop.
author: DeAnna U.

description:
I would give this place 4 stars for the sushi. Yes, sushi and sashimi were good. Portions were good. The chef was nice. I came in late at night and sat at the bar. I was confused because the waiter came by once to give me a drink menu. She didn't offer me any water or tea. Just a drink menu which had wine, beer, tea, and soda. Then she left for a good 5 minutes (at the time, there were only one table and another person at the bar eating). I decided to order to green tea, $3.50. It wasn't hot green tea in a pretty cup. It was just a bottle of "iced" tea that I could just pick up at Walgreens. 

The chef then asked me to order which hit me that the "menu" were the rolls written on a chalk board behind the chef with no price tag anywhere to be seen. That's it, just about 8 rolls and some nigiri hanging on the wall. Fine. I ordered a cherry blossom roll and some sweet shrimp. Those tasted delicious, by the way. The bill came out to be $27 for one roll, one order of sweet shrimp, and one bottle of tea. I would say my experience there was a confusing one but the food was good.
author: LeTran B.

description:
WOW - have lived in the Richmond for just over 4yrs now and can't believe it took this long to stumble in here - being just down street from Lou's (outstanding  subs), have walked by many times...anyhooo

Smallish place, typical sushi bar, tables for ~25 - two sushi chefs working with two waitresses - tried grilled squid, uni nigiri, escolar nigiri, spider roll, Mango/Hamachi roll - all were really, really good.

Uni - our favorite to have and seem to be a good barometer of quality; solid serving, albeit a bit on expensive side at $10 for two pieces, but super fresh, piled high inside the little nigiri pocket

Escolar was super delicate almost buttery in flavor (sooooo good) - in fact, we ordered two orders of both the Uni & Escolar.

Mango/Hamachi a nice roll served with a creamy white sauce that had just a tough of fruity sweetness to it, not too much though and complimented the roll very well.

Spider roll is a staple - good panko crust on crab and cooked very well - nearly too well done as the panko was pretty dark but it really wasn't bad at all (about the only complaint if any) - ate the entire thing and would easily order it again.

Service was pleasant enough - solid, solid sushi place and reasonable value - nothing to give it 5 stars, but would easily go back again as it is just around corner!!
author: Richard D.

description:
Ariake and Koo are officially my favorite Japanese restaurants in San Francisco now. Both authentically Japanese. Ariake is quite innovative with its premium rolls - Hamachi Mango rolls are highly recommended, flashy and pretty in presentation as well as taste and originality. Ariake roll though on the other hand is too fish with the seaweed. 
The Ikejime Tai sashimi special is extremely good, fresh, and melts in my mouth.. the crystal texture and look is also very appealing. I made sure that i carefully chewed each piece.

The street parking is stringent, very busy and somewhat tricky geary street, back street parking are slightly better. Walking 2 blocks on a weekend is normal. Restaurant is very small and crammed.

Service is average, considering the restaurant is quite busy, it is okay. Focus on the food!
author: Dilys S.

description: Highly recommend  this sushi restaurant. Was in the area with a friend and decided to try it out. Staff was very helpful, warm and inviting. Food was very fresh and perfect portions. The atmosphere was great very cozy and relaxing. The bathroom and restaurant were very clean. This is one place I will come to again!
author: Amy B.

description:
One of the few places still open for dinner at 9pm on a Saturday. Was starting to think this place was pretty solid until I saw the $140 bill. DEFINITELY NOT WORTH IT. Tried going to Koppou Gomi to begin with but they were already closed. It would've been 10x better there for the same price.  

Ordered a bunch of sashimi from the specials board. The sashimi was the thinnest and smallest pieces I've ever seen. The scallops were crazy thin and were $20. The toro the chef kept pushing was alright but also not worth the $20 price tag. The miso soup was sickly sweet and I couldn't even finish it. Sake wasn't served nearly cold enough. 

Waitress was all over the place. At one point she filled up my tea cup and left without filling my friends even though I hadn't taken a sip out of mine and his was completely empty wtf? They also refused to let us sit at the tables further in incase a bigger group of people showed up even though we were one of the last customers that came in. 

They did have multiple televisions playing the football game though if you're into that. I rarely see sushi places with tv's.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
1. Waited for meal over 45 minutes 
2. When asked about  delay totally  brushed off twice, by smirking waitresses who obviously  found out our concerns  amusing.
3. Order "vegetables  and prawnS" , emphasis on S, plural. There was a tone of vegetables  and 1, I repeat 1 (One) prawn. Unreal.
4. Waitress gave us a bill, and then instead  of returning  our card, just sat down to eat. Wow. Seriously, couldn't  finish up charge, and then eat? 
Anyhow you just lost yourself  a customer.
author: Dell B.

description: Love this place!  the owners-Jin and Hee, have run it for the better part of two decades, and it's their baby. Jin knows how to select the best fish, and it shows.  Ask him what's best, and it's hard to go wrong.   Waitresses provide thoughtful service.
author: Don T.

description:
It has been way too long since I have had good sushi! The fish was SUPER fresh like melt in my mouth fresh. Delicious.

The rolls were good and savory and I recommend the Moon Dog Roll! Soo good!

Some people on yelp seem to be saying stuff because it's Korean owned, but guys almost all sushi restaurants are Korean owned & it doesn't even matter cuz the food is good!

Highly recommend!
author: Cristy L.

description:
I had a really weird and uncomfortable experience at this restaurant.  I was having dinner with my girlfriend, we are sitting at the sushi bar chatting and enjoying our meal when my friend tells me that she is going to send me a text message and to look at it.  She writes that there is this creepy man staring at you, giving you elevator eyes. 

I've been noticing this man staring at me 3 seats away at the sushi bar but have been trying to ignore him, but when my friend notices and points it out I can't ignore it anymore.  Now I am feeling very uncomfortable and I can't enjoy my food because I feel very creeped out.  So after a few more minutes of attempting to ignore the staring, I turn and face the man and ask him, "Are you staring at me?" The creepy stranger starts mumbling something in his poor French-English saying something about studying here and that he was just watching the television on the other side of me.  I very well know he wasn't looking at the TV when his eyes were burning into me.

Now he is embarrassed for being called out and shows me his French-American Alien card for some reason and shows me how much he spent at the restaurant.  It was very strange and he made it more uncomfortable by continuing to explain.  I told him it was fine, my friend and I are just trying to enjoy our meal and to please leave us alone. Shortly thereafter he leaves Ariake.

The owner of the restaurant and main sushi chef must have been watching this encounter because as soon as the weirdo creeper leaves, he starts scolding me.  The owner says that the man is a regular customer and spends a lot of money there, he obviously does NOT care/understand how uncomfortable I felt.  I felt even more doubly uncomfortable as I am Korean-American and I know that the owner is Korean and Korean men from his era are historically misogynistic.  Rape wasn't even reported until a couple years ago and customarily it was considered the woman's fault in South Korea.  Therefore who cares if a strange man was staring at me, I was probably asking for it right? I was in the wrong here obviously.....

I live several blocks away and I love sushi but I am never coming here again.  Ladies and gentleman, unless you enjoy stepping into the realm of the 1960's where misogynistic ways of man rule the planet, I wouldn't suggest you spend your money here either.
author: Clover S.

description:
I know the owner since he was working in Ebisu, 22 years ago. When Jin opened Ariake, I never went back to Ebisu. The freshest fish and good service. That the only place I go for sushi   
ever. Thanks, Jin.
author: Elina B.

description: Soooooo I just moved back from nyc....and this place is three blocks from my house! The fish is very fresh...huge variety......they will make the rolls the way you would like them which is nice..I know loads of places that would not do this.....in addition and MOST IMPORTANTLY.....the owner and the people who work there are like a family. They are so incredibly sweet......I love going back because the food is incredible....the service is incredible and the staff is just amazing!!! Well done!!!!
author: Amavi D.

description:
Since Midori lost their old chef I've been searching for a new neighborhood spot. I'm still looking unfortunately. 

I stopped in for lunch today and had a bento box. The salmon teriyaki was decent. The teriyaki sauce was better than average and the salmon wasn't too dry. The tempura was really good - crispy and light instead of what most places have. The California roll was just ok. I don't understand why places make a bento box California roll so different from the one you get if you order off the menu.  That one looked much much better. The miso soup was the highlight of my meal. It's the best I've had in a while.

My boyfriend ordered Chirashi B and said the fish was good, all the little pickled veggies were tasty too. 

Service was lovely, it seems like a really nice family runs the place. 

I'll be back, but with Amphawa across the street and Lou's a couple storefronts down I'm not sure when.
author: Kristyn K.

description: Outstanding fresh sushi with wide variety to choose from along with creative rolls. Chefs are very skilled and fun to allow them to choose for you.  Intimate atmosphere and attentive staff at the Inner Richmond neighborhood. Enjoyed the Shima Aji, Hon Maguro, Kanpachi, Hirame, Tasmania,  ikejime Tai, Ju Toro and Yellow Tail.
author: Roy A.

description: This place is actually stellar. It's one of the few places in the city i would go so far to say is my go-to place for any cuisine (as I believe there's so many great options). As far as sushi goes, I'm never disappointed by Ariake. The wait-staff are so friendly and sushi chefs behind the counter always recognize and greet me warmly. It's a great start to the meal. As far the food goes, it's equally welcoming. I've come here (and dragged friends as well) around 4 times and we have never been disappointed! Definitely try any mango roll -- the mango is super fresh and compliments the equally if not fresher fish perfectly. Also go for the miso soup with clams - so warm and comforting. This place is tremendous and I cannot wait to go back!
author: Ditha B.

description:
I took a long walk down Geary in the rain hoping to check out Kabuto, but heck, it was closed! There, a few doors down sitting pretty was Ariake, and it was warm and comforting once I walked inside. The place is tiny with less than ten small tables arranged along one side of the restaurant next to a vertical sushi bar where a jumbo flat screen TV showed Monday night football. The ambiance was soothing and reminded me of Tanuki or Takao without the table cloths. There was also an air of seriousness with its straight laced decor while the sushi chefs chatted away casually with their regular customers about football and Jerry Rice. The place was crowded and festive.

Nestled by the end corner of the sushi bar facing the TV with my back against the door, I ordered their sushi dinner--Love ($20.95). It came with eight pieces of nigiri, tekka maki, salad, miso, and edamame. The nigiri pieces had good portion and they were thick and very fresh. The taste was outstanding and each piece had all the firm and buttery texture at the right places. I thought the eel, tuna, white tuna, yellowtail, salmon and scallop were flavorful, and the sea urchin and salmon roes caught me off guard with a mouthful of deliciousness. Everything was pretty standard while their dessert options were weak and lacking. 

Overall I thought their menu was pretty standard and somewhat lacked innovation but they were very good at what they do. In addition, I thought their prices were decent since it could be cheaper but it was still quite affordable for the quality you get. If there is one stark limitation, it would be their service as it was quite spotty for me while the chefs and servers were visibly cliquish with their regulars. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to develop a sense of belonging to connect with the place. Here's how they fared as a result:

1.) Quality and freshness: 5 stars
2.) Creativity and presentation: 4 stars 
3.) Quantity and substance: 4 stars
4.) Accessibility and affordability: 3 stars
5.) Service and ambiance: 2 stars

Not yet a fan, 3.5 stars for the overall experience. I find their fresh nigiri tasty and enjoyable so I look forward to going back to give them another try.
author: Daniel L.

description:
I was rather looking forward to trying this place tonight because of their chirashi selection but was I able to? NO. The fiance and I went tonight for some grub after a long week of work. Everything was good until i placed an order for the Ariake Chirashi, no rice sub for more salad or something - not difficult right? WRONG. Our waitress came back a few minutes later and was like sorry we can't make it that way. Seriously you can't sub out rice for more lettuce? it's not like its a maki roll or something. Literally you are just adding more lettuce and then putting the fish on top. I think this is the first time ever i was told that can't happen which frankly mind boggled me a bit. This pretty much annoyed me to no end and kinda turned me off from the place. The second thing was the wait for the good. There was a rather long gap of time between each dish that was brought out instead of it all being together. I ended up getting the sashimi combo and a salad and the fiance got one of the mango rolls and one of the taco rolls along with a house salad. The rolls were ok but nothing out of this world. The sashimi was typical sashimi and rather pricey personally. 

The chirashi thing just really annoyed me...
author: Tao Tao W.

description: Came here for my brother's 24th birthday today. The establishment is very very clean and well decorated. Staff is very welcoming. The sushi bar is very prompt and the food is amazing. The escolar was delicious and fresh. Definitely recommended to anyone. Top sushi places around.
author: Thomas G.

description: Jin + his staff are amazing. Really nice + attentive - never a bad experience. Food is always fresh. When we're in the mood for sushi, we always come here + leave happy.
author: Julie L.

description:
If you are looking for a warmer and friendly service out in the richmond, you should check this place out. 

Food was amazing. Great sushi and service.
author: Iris C.

description:
Beef teriyaki dinner. Yum. They use rib eye and it was super tender. 

The quality of the sashimi is really good though. Very fresh.

The prices are a bit high though.. And the waitress wasn't too attentive with refilling water/tea.

And what's with no dessert options when you order a dinner entree? lol.
author: Susan Y.

description:
Ariake is favorite from Omakase.
Enjoy a delightful OMAKASE style dinner.
Yummy yummy in my tummy.
Wonderful staff .
Yes I'll be back 
Great all -around experience.
author: Bay L.

description: Excellent service - seated our party of 10 almost immediately per our reservation even though the entire restaurant is smaller than the average room in San Francisco. Nice and cozy and pleasant decor. Sushi was fresh and delicious. Had a great time!
author: Grace W.

description:
Delicious fresh fish! Everything was incredible. Good sized portions.

I went here with my honey and we accidentally spent $92. Oops! That toro was almost worth it though, at $13 per order of nigiri.
author: Lea G.

description:
I reneg on my prior review.  Now it is Whoa, talk about shocked.  As in what happened.  It has been tasking to find a true quality sushi restaurant in San Francisco.  If you have been to Japan, LA, etc you know what I am talking about.  My last two visits no Jin San, who makes certain sushi rice is on point very well seasoned and flavorful and his knife skills/presentation are excellent.

His fill in sushi chefs, sub par experience.  Staff as well.  It is as if when he is not there all goes south.  We usually get complimentary edemame, I inquired we did not get any and the waitress said they don't give it.  Then a Caucasian couple sat a few seats down and low and behold, edemame with compliments!!

Ordered my usual, nigiri Scottish salmon, hamachi, maguro, sake, uni.  Rice was falling apart while picking up.  The rice was bland almost tasteless.  The cuts of fish were a bit smaller and in blocks rather than the usual slices.  If you know fish the cut alters the whole experience.  Such a shame never going back again.
author: Grubnoisseur Y.

description:
I'm going to Ariake tonight (I estimate this will be my 235th face-stuffing session) and I thought I'd write a shiny review. 

I would be happy eating exclusively at this place for the rest of my life. Not only is it a lovely, cozy place to go either with your family, friends or on some kind of date situation, the wait staff is super friendly and accommodating, the chefs are very friendly and quick, and they remember us every time we go! Not that you'll have any trouble ordering (everything is delicious), these are some of my favorites: 

Firecraker
Moon Dog Roll
Spider Roll 
Salmon Sashimi 
Bonito (the large plate with the ponzu sauce) 
Toro Nigiri
Shima Aji 

Wash it all down with some hot sake and you're one satisfied fatty. Get ready to roll out of this place.
author: Chelsea B.

description: Really good sushi - high quality fish and nice service. Feels authentic Japanese but they do have a lot of Godzilla rolls etc as well as tempura and udon
author: David G.

description:
Super nice and friendly Sushi men. 
Staff could improve. 
It is a tiny place and they will make you feel at home. 
Very similar to the real Sushi bar in Japan.
author: Bruno S.

description:
I came here because it was getting late and my guy and I were craving sushi for my pre-birthday meal (everyone celebrates that, right?). 
It was a Wednesday night and we found parking right away. We entered the restaurant and were immediately greeted by a very kind hostess. There were two tables full and a couple people at the bar. We chose to sit at the bar. They had the Giants game on TV and everyone was watching.
We ordered some sushi rolls and were recommended the chef's choice so we went with it. The chef's choice was honestly the best part of the meal. We got to try every fish on the menu and they were all fantastic. Butter fish was PERFECT. Like how have I lived my whole life without trying that?! 
The Lion King roll was okay but I think I've decided I prefer cold sushi over warm. It wasn't that fantastic.
The highlight of the experience was the Giants winning the game and everyone in the restaurant getting a complimentary shot of sake! So fun! 

Overall everyone was so nice, the service was great and we enjoyed our meal. We'll definitely be back!
author: Mariah O.

description:
MMMM TORO! 

Yes, every so often I will splurge on this delicate fatty tuna and every single time I will LOVE it. This time was no exception. I've had toro at other spots where they charge and arm and a leg and only give you one itty bitty piece. Here the serving came with two very healthy slices of buttery, fish goodness. Well worth the price and then some.

Everything else I shared here with my buddies was also delicious. The rolls themselves were fanftastic and (relatively) inventive, the shashimi was fresh and melt in your mouth good. I particularly loved the Hamachi Mango and the Ms. Vivian. We also split a couple of appetizers like the Yaki Saba, a grilled mackerel which was also very tasty. 

The waitstaff was very attentive, refilling my tea regularly and quickly. I was in the start of a head cold so I appreciated the never ending stream of tea! The restaurant itself is not very big but not uncomfortable and there was no wait on a Friday night which my hungry tummy appreciated. 

My three buddies and I ordered a crap ton of food and a couple of beers. We held our breath when the bill came around and while it was not cheap it wasn't quite as break-the-bank painful as we had anticipated, especially considering the quality of the food. I'd happy drag myself back here and eat my self silly any day of the week! If my checkbook could afford such regular indulgences!
author: Annette J.

description:
came here on a random father-daughter day outing. Dad was craving some solid sushi and decided to meet up with his only daughter in the City. 

ordered:

edamame 

hidden treasure - a chef special with some fresh raw fish and shrimp and shizo leaves and with a simple clean taste. I would have loved some heat added but then it would have been a ceviche and totally different 

Ariake roll - a 3 spicy tuna combo covered in seaweed salad - spicy tuna and seaweed salad can't go wrong

Dragon roll - crab meat and prawn tempura w/ cucumber and eel - solid! 

inside out roll - tuna inside and out - solid! 

and tempura - solid

Overall very attentive service, everything tasted fresh and clean and I will def be back!
author: Jade W.

description:
This is one gem of a place. Great selection of fish, quality cuts and taste, great presentation, wonderful service, and a price that matches what the quality you're getting. 

There are a lot of sushi restaurants on Geary Blvd but this has got to be one of my favorites. Not only is the food delicious, but the customer service is also pleasant and I have never had a bad experience yet. 

Atmosphere in the restaurant is nice, they even have a TV behind the sushi bar if you want to keep up with one of the sports games that's currently on. Will definitely be back.
author: Cara O.

description:
I'm not sure why everyone thinks the sushi here is so good. Maybe it was the night I came, but the fish was definitely not fresh. I had a piece that was definitely frozen then thawed (I think it was the Shiro Maguro). Also, the Saba was a little thick cut and somewhat rubbery. In general, I suspect they compensate for the fish quality by having large pieces.
However, everyone was very nice and the cooked items were very good (hamachi Kama and Unagi were great) so you may want to stick with that or the rolls (which seem popular).
author: Ray N.

description: I love this place. My friend and I came for lunch, and it is cozy and the sashimi combo lunch was DELICIOUS. Super fresh. Definitely recommend!
author: Mel G.

description: The food is delicious and fresh and they have some unique rolls. Staff are super friendly and helpful. It's always busy so make a reservation. Sit at the sushi bar and let the chef surprise you. Live Scallop, Tataki and Fire Cracker are my go to dishes.
author: Ian H.

description:
Jin and his staff are wonderful and make some deliciously fresh sushi!  I have been going to Ariake for many years and the quality is always excellent.  The 49er roll is my personal favorite as they cover the salmon with a paper thin slice of lemon (unlike other restaurants that put a slab of lemon) that brings out the best in the salmon and the hint of lemon is perfect!

They still make some of the best sushi but my only complaint is that they used to put the biggest pieces of fish in their Sashimi and Nigiri and now they are closer to what most sushi restaurants in SF offer- smaller portioned fish presumably as the price of fish goes up they are trying to keep their prices reasonable
author: Jeremy H.

description:
Being on a low carb, sugar detox makes eating out a lot harder. I am not saying the diet is hard for me, just trying to figure out what i can eat out that doesn't have added sugar is hard. So why not eat raw fish! Can't go wrong with that ;)

Ariake is a Korean owned Japanese restro with a touch of modern kick in their sushi and sushi rolls. After a hardcore workout, my mind only leads to one thing: PROTEIN!!! i need to restore that protein. My workout buddy and i were trying to find a place to eat after being at the gym 2-3 hrs one Tuesday night. Took out the trusty ole yelp app and found Ariake cuz the first thing that came to mind was sashimi. 

The one thing that caught my eye and would be enough food for two people were the sushi and sashimi dinners.  Which are priced starting at 53-63 bucks. Seems like a lot of money but its totally worth it. You get a giant plate of sashimi, and about 8 nigiri and a sushi roll. They have 3 different sushi and sashimi dinners FAITH, HOPE and LOVE. Another time when i came, i got the combination plate which is essentially a 21 piece chirashi equivalent. Once again the fish was very fresh. Awesomeness 

Their sashimi is very fresh and the portions were awesome, i was content. Mission Complete. PROTEIN restored.
author: Jonathan W.

description: My wife and I really liked this place and used to go at least once a week. We just went again for dinner and the owner raised the prices on the menu to an unacceptable level. We typically don't look at the prices anymore and when we received our bill it was a shock! One example: we got charged $ 6.00!! for edamame, SERIOUSLY? The foodcost for that is a few cents. Other items on the menu were raised up to 30%. Granted, they have really good sushi but the owner's greed is getting the better of him. Everybody wants to make a good profit but Jin's (the owner) business practices are unethical & out of line. If he does not change, his business will be in trouble...karma will run its natural course.
author: Andy B.

description:
Generous servings of Sushi and nigiri , great cheap hose sake , and great service . 
Also some awesome selections on their special menu .best of all they all speak japanese ! 
Authentic !
author: Angelo G.

description: I'm glad to see the table service is poor from other yelpers. Get this...let's save some money and not give small plates to them when they are eating sushi so they can get their falling apart sushi all over their hands and table. Then let the customer ask for plates when its clear they need them. Oh and how about let's touch the top of the customers drinking straws so I can get my germs on it. But wait...now lets watch the customer look into their empty tea cup and never ever refill it and proceed to argue about an invoice with sushi chef instead of doing my job as the waitress.  Poor poor and even poorer service. If you don't like waiting tables...just Stop and you will make the world a happier place.
author: Angela L.

description:
**3.5 STARS**

After riding in and around the Presidio... S.O. was getting a tad bit grumpy b/c he was hungry. 

He started reading all the restaurant signs when we were on Geary... thus I asked him if he wanted to eat. Instead of answering, he literally just pulled over and parked... right in front of this place... 

OK... I guess we're eating a late lunch.

This place was tiny... I could definitely see this spot getting packed on a busy night! 

Friendly...  and prompt. And they have a lunch menu on a weekend. That caught me off guard... most places only honors their lunch menu on weekdays. That was cool.

S.O. ordered a Beef Teriyaki with a side of veggie tempura. He inhaled all of it. I didn't bother to ask if I could try... grumpy...

I ordered a shrimp roll... kapa maki ... and tomago... two out of three was decent but the tomago... egg tasted funny. I finished it for principle sake. 

Anyway... the NFL playoff game was on by the bar so that helped ... Not sure if we'll be back but since the sis lives around the area... possibly!
author: Cath M.

description: Very nice place. Great fresh food. During my visit here one of the guests was celebrating a birthday and I, along with the whole restaurant, sang the birthday song. Great ambiance all around. Very pleasant servers.
author: Vadim S.

description:
They use pretty damn good fish I must say. Our O-Toro, was indeed the buttery strip of perfection that I had hoped for. The hon-hamachi was great as well.

Would be a good place for a sushi happy hour type deal.
author: Misha T.

description:
One of my go-to Sushi places in the bay area!  I've only ever sat at the bar and order Omakase from the chefs.  Their fish is always fresh and I haven't been disappointed once!
